00045 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00046                                                unsigned long uld,
00047                                                unsigned long *r)
00048 {
00049     unsigned long long q, rf;
00050     unsigned long qh, rh, ql, qf;
00051     
00052     q = 0;
00053     rf = (unsigned long long)(0xFFFFFFFF - (qf = 0xFFFFFFFF / uld) * uld) + 1ULL;
00054     
00055     while (ull >= uld) 
00056         {
00057         ((unsigned long *)&q)[0] += (qh = ((unsigned long *)&ull)[0] / uld);
00058         rh = ((unsigned long *)&ull)[0] - qh * uld;
00059         q += rh * (unsigned long long)qf + (ql = ((unsigned long *)&ull)[1] / uld);
00060         ull = rh * rf + (((unsigned long *)&ull)[1] - ql * uld);
00061         }
00062 
00063     if (r)
00064         *r = ull;
00065 
00066     return q;
00067 }
00068 
00069 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ullmul(unsigned long m0, 
00070                                               unsigned long m1)
00071 {
00072     unsigned long long res;
00073     
00074     __asm__ __volatile__ ("mulhwu %0, %1, %2"
00075                           : "=r" (((unsigned long *)&res)[0]) 
00076                           : "%r" (m0), "r" (m1));
00077 
00078     ((unsigned long *)&res)[1] = m0*m1;
00079     
00080     return res;
00081 }
00082 
00083 static inline int rthal_imuldiv (int i, int mult, int div) {
00084 
00085     /* Returns (int)i = (int)i*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00086     
00087     unsigned long q, r;
00088     q = rthal_ulldiv(rthal_ullmul(i, mult), div, &r);
00089     return (r + r) > div ? q + 1 : q;
00090 }
00091 
00092 static inline long long rthal_llimd(long long ll, int mult, int div) {
00093 
00094     /* Returns (long long)ll = (int)ll*(int)(mult)/(int)div. */
00095 
00096     unsigned long long low;
00097     unsigned long q, r;
00098     
00099     low  = rthal_ullmul(((unsigned long *)&ll)[1], mult);       
00100     q = rthal_ulldiv(rthal_ullmul(((unsigned long *)&ll)[0], mult) + 
00101                      ((unsigned long *)&low)[0], div, (unsigned long *)&low);
00102     low = rthal_ulldiv(low, div, &r);
00103     ((unsigned long *)&low)[0] += q;
00104     
00105     return (r + r) > div ? low + 1 : low;
00106 }
00107 
00108 static inline unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00109 
00110     __asm__ __volatile__ ("cntlzw %0, %1" : "=r" (ul) : "r" (ul & (-ul)));
00111     return 31 - ul;
00112 }

00152 #define rthal_cli()                     adeos_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00153 #define rthal_sti()                     adeos_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain)
00154 #define rthal_local_irq_save(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_stall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00155 #define rthal_local_irq_restore(x)      adeos_restore_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain,(x))
00156 #define rthal_local_irq_flags(x)        ((x) = !!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00157 #define rthal_local_irq_test()          (!!adeos_test_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))
00158 #define rthal_local_irq_sync(x)         ((x) = !!adeos_test_and_unstall_pipeline_from(&rthal_domain))

00163 #define rthal_hw_disable()              adeos_hw_cli()

00174 static inline void rthal_spin_lock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00175 
00176     rthal_cli();
00177     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00178 }
00179 
00180 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irq(spinlock_t *lock) {
00181 
00182     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00183     rthal_sti();
00184 }

00186 static inline unsigned long rthal_spin_lock_irqsave(spinlock_t *lock) {
00187 
00188     unsigned long flags;
00189     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00190     rthal_spin_lock(lock);
00191     return flags;
00192 }

00194 static inline void rthal_spin_unlock_irqrestore(unsigned long flags,
00195                                                 spinlock_t *lock) {
00196     rthal_spin_unlock(lock);
00197     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags);

00200 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00201 #define rthal_cpu_relax(x) \
00202 do { \
00203    int i = 0; \
00204    do \
00205      cpu_relax(); \
00206    while (++i < x); \
00207 } while(0)
00208 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00210 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the RTAI
00211    domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task address
00212    using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack pointer
00213    instead. */
00214 
00215 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_root_current (int cpuid) {
00216     return ((struct thread_info *)(adp_root->esp[cpuid] & (~8191UL)))->task;
00217 }
00218 
00219 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_get_current (int cpuid)
00220 
00221 {
00222     register unsigned long esp asm ("r1");
00223     /* FIXME: r2 should be ok or even __adeos_current_threadinfo() - offsetof(THREAD) */
00224     
00225     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 8192)
00226         return rthal_get_root_current(cpuid);
00227 
00228     return current;
00229 }

00231 static inline void rthal_set_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00232 
00233     if (delay) {
00234 #ifdef CONFIG_40x
00235         mtspr(SPRN_PIT,delay);
00236 #else /* !CONFIG_40x */
00237         set_dec(delay);
00238 #endif /* CONFIG_40x */
00239     }
00240 }

00259 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU

00261 typedef struct rthal_fpenv {
00262     
00263     /* This layout must follow exactely the definition of the FPU
00264        backup area in a PPC thread struct available from
00265        <asm-ppc/processor.h>. Specifically, fpr[] an fpscr words must
00266        be contiguous in memory (see arch/ppc/fpu.S). */
00267 
00268     double fpr[32];
00269     unsigned long fpscr_pad;    /* <= Hi-word of the FPR used to */
00270     unsigned long fpscr;        /* retrieve the FPSCR. */
00271 
00272 } rthal_fpenv_t;
